references.paper_title: Larp: Language-agent role play for open-world games
references.reason: This paper introduces a novel Language-agent role play framework for open-world games, which is highly relevant to the task of embodied intelligence and long-horizon planning.

references.paper_title: A survey on recent advances in Ilm-based multi-turn dialogue systems
references.reason: This survey provides a comprehensive overview of recent advancements in large language model-based multi-turn dialogue systems, offering insights into their capabilities and limitations in the context of embodied intelligence.

references.paper_title: A survey of embodied ai: From simulators to research tasks
references.reason: This survey paper offers a comprehensive overview of the field of embodied AI, examining the transition from simulators to real-world tasks, which is directly relevant to the research presented in the current paper.

references.paper_title: React: Synergizing reasoning and acting in language models
references.reason: This paper introduces the ReAct framework which synergizes reasoning and acting in large language models, providing a baseline model against which the current paper's approach is evaluated.

references.paper_title: Textworld: A learning environment for text-based games
references.reason: This paper describes the TextWorld environment, used in this work to evaluate the performance of the proposed STMA model for embodied task planning.
